title: Nicholas Hoult on Upcoming Tom Ford Film, Wanting to Star in a Western or a Racing Movie, and Go-Karting With His Son
description: Nicholas Hoult, speaking at Red Sea Film Festival on Monday, touched on his upcoming Tom Ford movie, â€œCry to Heaven,â€ the adaptation of Anne Riceâ€™s
body:
Nicholas Hoult, speaking at Red Sea Film Festival on Monday, touched on his upcoming Tom Ford movie, â€œCry to Heaven,â€ the adaptation of Anne Riceâ€™s 1982 novel.

	Hoult stars alongside Adele, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, CiarÃ¡n Hinds, George MacKay, Mark Strong, Colin Firth, Paul Bettany, Hunter Schafer and Thandiwe Newton, among others.

	Hoult, who previously appeared in Fordâ€™s â€œA Single Man,â€ said: â€œYeah, we start shooting next year for that. Iâ€™m really looking forward to being back on set with Tom. Heâ€™s a wonderful director to work with. Just his attention to detail. His understanding of the emotions of the characters. Heâ€™s written a really beautiful script, and itâ€™s a wonderful cast. So Iâ€™m really looking forward to working with everyone.â€
	

	Hoult, who recently appeared in Clint Eastwoodâ€™s â€œJuror #2,â€ said that heâ€™d like to do a Western. â€œWorking with Clint, I went back and watched all of his classic movies. One of my all time favorite movies is â€˜Unforgiven.â€™ I think itâ€™s a masterpiece. So I really at some point want to do a Western.â€


	Hoult has been taking part in the Ferrari Challenge Series and had a crash racing this year at Daytona. He is likely to have his first proper race in March, he said, and added that heâ€™d love to be in a racing movie. 

	He said: â€œI find [racing] very similar to acting, in some ways. Itâ€™s like an intense focus, but also this kind of flow state where itâ€™s input, output. Youâ€™re just focusing on, like, what you need to look at, whatâ€™s happening, and then what you need to do too, and so theyâ€™re very similar in many ways. Like acting, youâ€™re looking at the other person, seeing whatever it is, observing, and then hopefully the output comes naturally. 
	

	â€œSo thereâ€™s a lot of similarities, but itâ€™s also terrifying. I had my first crash at Daytona this year. That was a weird thing, because as I was spinning across the track, all I can remember thinking was, â€˜Oh, this is what it feels like.â€™ You know, when you havenâ€™t experienced something before and itâ€™s happening, and itâ€™s quick, but itâ€™s happening, and youâ€™re like, â€˜Oh, this is it.â€™ And itâ€™s not necessarily like a total fear, but itâ€™s like, â€˜Huh,â€™ because you canâ€™t imagine what that feels like. So then when it happens, you go, â€˜Oh, thatâ€™s the feeling â€¦ interesting.'â€

	Hoult said that after he and his son watched â€œF1: The Movie,â€ one of the first movies theyâ€™ve gone to see as father and son, they then went go-karting. â€œI took him go-karting a few weeks after that, and just as we were about to walk out the door, he goes, â€˜Wait, wait, wait,â€™ and he goes running off, and he comes back. â€˜Whereâ€™d you go? What happened? What is it?â€™ And he showed me he had two playing cards. I donâ€™t know if you remember Brad Pittâ€™s character has his two playing cards, his lucky playing cards for whenever he drives. So my son was like, â€˜Oh, I need my playing cards to be like Brad.'â€

schema.headline: Nicholas Hoult on Upcoming Tom Ford Film, Wanting to Star in a Western or a Racing Movie, and Go-Karting With His Son

title: â€˜My Life With the Walter Boysâ€™ Adds Three to Cast for Season 3
description:
Netflixâ€™s teen drama â€œMy Life With the Walter Boysâ€ has added three more recurring cast members for Season 3.

	Chad Rook (â€œIt: Welcome to Derry,â€ â€œ
body:
Netflixâ€™s teen drama â€œMy Life With the Walter Boysâ€ has added three more recurring cast members for Season 3.

	Chad Rook (â€œIt: Welcome to Derry,â€ â€œJoe Pickettâ€) has joined as Mac, described as â€œa cool drag racer who hires Cole to revamp the engine of one of his racing cars. After seeing Cole take the car for a spin on the track, Mac is impressed by Coleâ€™s natural skills behind the wheel.â€


	Naveen Paddock (â€œMighty Ducks: Game Changers,â€ â€œAnythingâ€™s Possibleâ€) is Eliot, Uncle Richardâ€™s new intern who is handsome and charming, with an air of New York sophistication. Eliotâ€™s arrival in Silver Falls leaves Jackie caught between her old life in Manhattan and her new one in rural Colorado.
	

	Erin Karpluk (â€œBeing Erica,â€ â€œSmokeâ€) will play Hannah, the nomadic sister of George and mother to Isaac and Lee. Per Netflix, â€œHannah is a free spirit or irresponsible as hell (take your pick). She previously left her sons to live with the Walters and then split for reasons unknown, but when she suddenly shows up at the front door a thousand days later, she has a lot of bridges to rebuild.â€


	Based on the coming-of-age novel by Ali Novak, â€œMy Life With the Walter Boysâ€ follows Jackie Howard, an orphaned teenager who relocates from New York City to rural Colorado after the Walter family takes her in. She soon finds herself caught in a love triangle between two of the brothers.

	Season 3 of the series has wrapped production in Canada and will premiere on Netflix sometime in 2026. Rook, Paddock and Karpluk join series regulars Nikki Rodriguez, Sarah Rafferty, Marc Blucas, Noah LaLonde, Ashby Gentry, Connor Stanhope and Jaylan Evans, as well as a recurring cast that includes Corey Fogelmanis, Johnny Link, Isaac Arellanes, Myles Perez, Alisha Newton, Mya Lowe, Ellie Oâ€™Brien, Kolton Stewart, Natalie Sharp, Alex Quijano, Ashley Tavares, Dean Petriw, Alix West Lefler, Lennix James and Gabrielle Jacinto.

schema.headline: â€˜My Life With the Walter Boysâ€™ Adds Three to Cast for Season 3

title: Bill Lawrenceâ€™s â€˜Roosterâ€™ Starring Steve Carrell to Debut on HBO in March (TV News Roundup)
description: HBO will debut the original comedy series â€œRoosterâ€ in March 2026. Starring Steve Carell, who executive produces alongside series creators Bill Lawr
body:
HBO will debut the original comedy series â€œRoosterâ€ in March 2026. Starring Steve Carell, who executive produces alongside series creators Bill Lawrence and Matt Tarses, the 10-episode season will premiere on HBO and will also be available to stream on HBO Max.

	Set on a college campus, â€œRoosterâ€ will follow a middle aged author (Carell) navigating a complicated relationship with his daughter (Charly Clive).


	In addition to Carell and Clive, the show will also star Danielle Deadwyler, Phil Dunster, John C. McGinley, and Lauren Tsai. Jeff Ingold, Jonathan Krisel, Barbie Adler, Annie Mebane, David Stassen, Anthony King and Liza Katzer join Carell, Lawrence and Tarses as executive producers
	

	The series was made by Warner Bros. Television, where Tarses and Lawrence both have overall deals.Â 
	
		TRAILERS	

	NBC has unveiled the official trailer for the second season of â€œThe Hunting Party,â€ which returns to the network on Jan. 8, 2026.

	The series stars Melissa Roxburgh, Nick Weschler, Patrick Sabongui, Josh McKenzie and Sara Garcia and features guest star appearances from Eric McCormack, Finnigan McCormack, Kelsey Grammer, Niecy Nash-Betts, Liz Gillies, Jefferson White and more.

	Season 2 will follow the small team of investigators led byÂ former FBI profiler Rebecca â€œBexâ€ Henderson (Melissa Roxburgh). According to the official synopsis, â€œTheyâ€™ve been assembled to track down and capture the most dangerous killers the world has ever seen, all of whom have just escaped from â€˜The Pit,â€™ a top-secret government prison thatâ€™s not supposed to exist.
	

	The synopsis continues, â€œAs Bex races to catch these killers before itâ€™s too late, sheâ€™ll discover the one thing more twisted than the dangerous fugitives sheâ€™s chasing is the prison itself that they just escaped fromâ€¦because â€˜The Pitâ€™ wasnâ€™t just a prison.â€

	â€œThe Hunting Partyâ€ was created by JJ Bailey, who also serves as co-showrunner and executive producer alongside Jake Coburn. Thor Freudenthal also executive produces and directs the series. Michael Jones Morales pens the script and is another executive producer on the show.

	Check out the trailer for Season 2 of â€œThe Hunting Partyâ€ below:



	
		DATES	

	Wonder Projectâ€™s new family drama series, â€œItâ€™s Not Like That,â€ will premiere with its first two episodes through its subscription service on Prime Video on Jan. 25, 2026.

	The following eight episodes of the season will then debut weekly. Â Wonder Project will also sample the first episode on Prime Video for all subscribers on Jan. 25, 2026, with a global release on Prime Video to follow at a later date.

	Starring Scott Foley, â€œItâ€™s Not Like Thatâ€ follows Malcolm (Foley), a pastor who is a recently widowed dad of three. The official logline states, â€œ Lori (Erinn Hayes) is newly divorced with two teens. Their families once did everything together, but now Malcolm and Lori must navigate their newly minted singledom, parenthood and the complexities of Malcolm being a modern-day pastor. Is this the beginning of a love story? Itâ€™s not like that. Or is it?â€

	The cast also includes J.R. Ramirez as David Soto, Caleb Baumann as Merritt Soto, Cary Christopher as Justin Jeffries, Leven Miranda as Flora Jeffries, Liv Lindell as Casey Soto and Cassidy Paul as Penelope Jeffries.

	â€œItâ€™s Not Like Thatâ€ was created by Ian Deitchman and Kristin Robinson, who also serve as showrunners alongside executive producer Garrett Lerner.

schema.headline: Bill Lawrenceâ€™s â€˜Roosterâ€™ Starring Steve Carrell to Debut on HBO in March (TV News Roundup)

body:
On todayâ€™s episode of â€œDaily Varietyâ€ podcast, Paramount Skydance goes hostile for Warner Bros. Discovery. Will David Ellison bust up WBDâ€™s engagement to Netflix? title: Spotify Wrapped Breaks Own Record With 250 Million Engagements in Less Than Three Days
description:
After launching last week, Spotify Wrapped has become the streamerâ€™s biggest thus far.

	Wrapped, which was unveiled on Dec. 3, drew 250 million eng
body:
After launching last week, Spotify Wrapped has become the streamerâ€™s biggest thus far.

	Wrapped, which was unveiled on Dec. 3, drew 250 million engaged users in only 65 hours, a milestone that took over a week to reach in 2024. In that same timeframe, Wrapped shares grew to 575 million, while shares on Instagram nearly doubled year over year.

	On a more granular level, there were over 65 million shares from the Listening Age story, a newly added feature that calculated how old a given user is based on annual listening habits. Elsewhere, in-app messaging on Spotify grew 100 percent, the biggest jump since the featureâ€™s announcement earlier this year.
	

	Wrapped launched as a revamped experience for 2025, refreshing previous inclusions like top genres and top songs. Spotify also rolled out new features like Listening Archive, which breaks down your most memorable streaming days, and Wrapped Party, an interactive feature that allows you to compare listening habits and compete with friends in bespoke breakout rooms.

	In tandem with the launch of Wrapped 2025, Spotify announced its year-end charts, with Bad Bunny becoming the top global artist of 2025. He ranked ahead of Taylor Swift, the Weeknd, Drake, Billie Eilish, Kendrick Lamar, Bruno Mars, Ariana Grande, Arijit Singh and Fuerza Regida.

	The Puerto Rican rapper also had the most-streamed global album of the year with â€œDeBÃ TiRAR MÃ¡S FOToS,â€ while Lady Gaga and Bruno Marsâ€™ â€œDie With a Smileâ€ topped the global songs of 2025 list. Taylor Swift was the top artist in the United States, and Lamarâ€™s â€œLutherâ€ featuring SZA was the top U.S. song of the year.

schema.headline: Spotify Wrapped Breaks Own Record With 250 Million Engagements in Less Than Three Days

title: Mariah Carey Earns Record-Tying 19th Week at No. 1 on Singles Chart With â€˜All I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€™
description: Mariah Carey has lodged a record-tying 19th week at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 as â€œAll I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€ rides the holiday wave back
body:
Mariah Carey has lodged a record-tying 19th week at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 as â€œAll I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€ rides the holiday wave back to the top of the charts.

	The recurrent tune surges four spots to the Hot 100 summit, tying the record for most weeks at the top alongside Shaboozeyâ€™s â€œA Bar Song (Tipsy)â€ and Lil Nas Xâ€™s â€œOld Town Roadâ€ featuring Billy Ray Cyrus. It also marks the seventh consecutive year that â€œAll I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€ has hit No. 1. The song previously became Careyâ€™s 19th No. 1 on the Hot 100, the most for any solo artist and only one behind the Beatles as the record-holder.
	

	Notably, Wham!â€™s â€œLast Christmasâ€ also sees a holiday bump, climbing from No. 6 to 2. Brenda Leeâ€™s â€œRockinâ€™ Around the Christmas Treeâ€ lands behind it at No. 3, followed by Bobby Helmsâ€™ â€œJingle Bell Rockâ€ and Huntr/xâ€™s â€œGolden.â€


	Over on the Billboard 200 tally, Taylor Swift continues her hot streak at No. 1 with â€œThe Life of a Showgirl,â€ which just lodged its eighth nonconsecutive week on the chart (it slid to No. 3 last week). It earned 99,000 equivalent album units, up 121 percent in album sales.

	Morgan Wallenâ€™s â€œIâ€™m the Problemâ€ comes in behind â€œShowgirlâ€ at No. 2, followed by the â€œKPop Demon Huntersâ€ soundtrack, Stray Kidsâ€™ â€œDo Itâ€ and the â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ soundtrack. Michael BublÃ©â€™s â€œChristmasâ€ reentered the top 10 at No. 6, followed by Bing Crosbyâ€™s â€œUltimate Christmas,â€ Olivia Deanâ€™s â€œThe Art of Loving,â€ Vince Guaraldi Trioâ€™s â€œA Charlie Brown Christmasâ€ soundtrack and Tate McRaeâ€™s â€œSo Close to What,â€ which sees a dip from No. 6 following the release of its deluxe edition.

schema.headline: Mariah Carey Earns Record-Tying 19th Week at No. 1 on Singles Chart With â€˜All I Want for Christmas Is Youâ€™

title: Netflix CEOs: â€˜Weâ€™re Super-Confidentâ€™ of Closing Warner Bros. Discovery Deal, Say Merger Will â€˜Protect Jobs in Entertainment Industryâ€™
description:
Dec 8, 2025 11:27am PT	
	

	
		Netflix CEOs: â€˜Weâ€™re Super-Confidentâ€™ of Closing Warner Bros. Discovery Deal, Say Merger Will â€˜Protect
body:
Dec 8, 2025 11:27am PT	
	

	
		Netflix CEOs: â€˜Weâ€™re Super-Confidentâ€™ of Closing Warner Bros. Discovery Deal, Say Merger Will â€˜Protect Jobs in Entertainment Industryâ€™
	

	Ted Sarandos and Greg Peters speak at UBS conference hours after Paramount Skydance launches hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
	
			


			
			
	

									Courtesy of Netflix
	

		
	
				
	Netflix co-CEOs Ted Sarandos and Greg Peters projected confidence and asserted that a Netflix takeover of Warner Bros. and HBO Max would â€œcreate and protect jobs in the entertainment industry.â€

	The pair spoke Monday at the UBS Global Media and Communications conference â€” hours after Paramount Skydance initiated a hostile offer presented as a tender offer to WBD shareholders. The pair also asserted that they are committed to Warner Bros. theatrical films in the same way that the studio operates now â€” addressing the immediate backlash from the film community out of concern that Netflix will dramatically shrink the theatrical exhibition window at a cornerstone film studio.
	

	â€œTodayâ€™s move was entirely expected,â€ Sarandos said. â€œWe have a deal done, and we are incredibly happy with the deal. We think itâ€™s great for our shareholders. Itâ€™s great for consumers. We think itâ€™s a great way to create and protect jobs in the entertainment industry. Weâ€™re super confident weâ€™re going to get it across the line and finish.â€


	More to come


	
		More from Variety

schema.headline: Netflix CEOs: â€˜Weâ€™re Super-Confidentâ€™ of Closing Warner Bros. Discovery Deal, Say Merger Will â€˜Protect Jobs in Entertainment Industryâ€™

title: â€˜The Copenhagen Testâ€™: Simu Liu Loses Control of His Mind in First Trailer for Peacock Spy Thriller
description: What happens when someone hacks your brain? Thatâ€™s exactly the challenge Simu Liuâ€˜s Alexander Hale is facing in Peacockâ€™s new espionage thriller, â€œT
body:
What happens when someone hacks your brain? Thatâ€™s exactly the challenge Simu Liuâ€˜s Alexander Hale is facing in Peacockâ€™s new espionage thriller, â€œThe Copenhagen Test.â€ The trailer for the series, produced by UCP, dropped on Monday, with all episodes debuting on December 27.

	Per the official logline, the â€œseries follows first-generation Chinese-American intelligence analyst Alexander Hale, who realizes his brain has been hacked, giving the perpetrators access to everything he sees and hears. Caught between his shadowy agency and the unknown hackers, he must maintain a performance 24/7 to flush out whoâ€™s responsible and prove where his allegiance lies.â€
	

	In addition to Liu, series regulars include Melissa Barrera, Sinclair Daniel, Brian dâ€™Arcy James), Mark Oâ€™Brien and Kathleen Chalfant. Barrera plays the agent assigned to watch Alexander â€” but could be more, as hinted at in the trailer.


	â€œThey want me to play the girlfriend,â€ she tells him. He responds, â€œOr youâ€™re just keeping an eye on me.â€

	Thomas Brandon is the creator and serves as executive producer, writer and co-showrunner. Jennifer Yale is co-showrunner, writer and executive producer. Executive producers include Liu, James Wan, Michael Clear, Rob Hackett, Mark Winemaker. Jet Wilkinson executive produces and directs the first two episodes. UCP is the studio.

	Watch the full trailer below:

schema.headline: â€˜The Copenhagen Testâ€™: Simu Liu Loses Control of His Mind in First Trailer for Peacock Spy Thriller

title: T-Mobile Unwraps Major Holiday Promo, Including Unbeatable iPhone and Galaxy Deals and Trade-In Offers
description:
Dec 8, 2025 11:15am PT	
	


		T-Mobile Unwraps Major Holiday Promo, Including Unbeatable iPhone and Galaxy Deals and Trade-In Offers
body:
Dec 8, 2025 11:15am PT	
	


		T-Mobile Unwraps Major Holiday Promo, Including Unbeatable iPhone and Galaxy Deals and Trade-In Offers
	
	
			


			
			
	

	

		
	
				
	If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	T-Mobile is kicking off the holiday shopping season with some of its most aggressive phone promotions to date, rolling out a slate of Apple and Samsung offers designed to bring families â€” and people looking to switch carriers â€” into the fold.

	At the center of their holiday offerings is the companyâ€™s marquee Apple deal: four iPhone 17 devices â€œon usâ€ when customers switch four lines for $25 per line when you trade-in four eligible phones. The limited-time promotion is being billed as the companyâ€™s â€œbest iPhone offer ever.â€


	Apple fans have several additional ways to score new hardware this season. T-Mobile is offering the iPhone 17 Pro â€œon usâ€ â€” no trade-in required â€” when you bring your number over and add a new line on an Experience Beyond plan, also running for a limited time. You can also scoop up the new Apple Watch SE 3 for just $99 when you add an eligible watch plan, making it an easy upgrade for your wrist, too.

	Samsungâ€™s lineup gets a similar spotlight in T-Mobileâ€™s holiday playbook. The carrier is touting its â€œbest Galaxy offer ever,â€ headlined by four Samsung Galaxy S25 devices â€œon usâ€ when customers switch four lines for $25 per line, again with no trade-in needed.

	A separate holiday offer for Samsung enthusiasts includes the Flip7 â€œon usâ€ â€” a value of $1.1k â€” with no trade-in required on T-Mobileâ€™s Experience Beyond or Next plans. That promotion runs for a limited time, giving holiday â€” and even early-January â€” shoppers a longer window.

	Across both device families, T-Mobile is doubling down on effortless upgrades: customers can hang onto their current phone and score a brand-new one for no extra cost â€” freeing them to gift, resell, or repurpose last yearâ€™s device while stepping into the latest flagship. With smartphone upgrades consistently peaking during the holidays â€” and both Apple and Samsung anchoring the premium device market â€” T-Mobile is positioning its lineup as a turnkey gifting solution for families looking to upgrade together.


	
		More from Variety

schema.headline: T-Mobile Unwraps Major Holiday Promo, Including Unbeatable iPhone and Galaxy Deals and Trade-In Offers

title: Warner Bros. Discovery Says It Will â€˜Carefullyâ€™ Review Paramount Skydance Acquisition Offer and Issue a Recommendation in 10 Business Days
description: Warner Bros. Discovery, responding to Paramount Skydanceâ€˜s unsolicited takeover offer to acquire all of WBDâ€™s outstanding stock for $30/share, said
body:
Warner Bros. Discovery, responding to Paramount Skydanceâ€˜s unsolicited takeover offer to acquire all of WBDâ€™s outstanding stock for $30/share, said it will review the proposal and issue its decision within 10 business days.

	For now, the WBD board â€œis not modifying its recommendation with respect to the agreement with Netflix,â€ the company said in a statement Monday. On Friday, WBD and Netflix announced a deal under whichÂ Netflix would buy Warner Bros.â€™s studio operations, HBO and HBO Max for $72 billionÂ (with an enterprise value of $82.7 billion). Paramountâ€™s hostile takeover bid, backed in part of three Arab sovereign wealth funds and Jared Kushnerâ€™s Affinity Partners, has an enterprise value at $108.4 billion.
	

	â€œThe Warner Bros. Discovery Board of Directors (the â€˜Boardâ€™), consistent with its fiduciary duties and in consultation with its independent financial and legal advisors, will carefully review and consider Paramount Skydanceâ€™s offer in accordance with the terms of Warner Bros. Discoveryâ€™s agreement with Netflix, Inc.,â€ the company said. â€œWarner Bros. Discovery intends to advise its stockholders of the Boardâ€™s recommendation regarding Paramount Skydanceâ€™s tender offer within 10 business days.â€


	Ten business days from Monday would be Friday, Dec. 19. Warner Bros. Discovery stockholders are advised â€œnot to take any action at this time with respect to Paramount Skydanceâ€™s proposal,â€ WBD said. 

	Allen & Co., J.P. Morgan and Evercore are serving as financial advisers to Warner Bros. Discovery and Wachtell Lipton, Rosen & Katz and Debevoise & Plimpton are serving as legal counsel.
	

	SEE ALSO: Paramount Launches Hostile Takeover Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Valued at $108 Billion, Seeking to Derail Netflixâ€™s Deal

schema.headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Says It Will â€˜Carefullyâ€™ Review Paramount Skydance Acquisition Offer and Issue a Recommendation in 10 Business Days

description:
TMZ Live Stream
                          Come Into Our Office and Watch News Happen!!!
body:
TMZ Live Stream
                          Come Into Our Office and Watch News Happen!!!
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 9:44 AM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated December 8, 2025 12:14 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          We want you to be a part of TMZ, so every weekday, between 9:30 AM and 11:30 AM PT, we take you inside our newsroom via live stream.
      
    
          You never know what you're gonna get ... a big story that breaks, an argument erupts in the room, or someone's just joking around.
      
    
          Your comments are a big part of the stream, and the staff spends a lot of time speaking directly to you. Every day is different!
      
    
          We also use our live stream to produce our "TMZ Live" TV show.

title: Utah Tech Player Suspended For Punching Opponent After Getting Dunked On
description:
Utah Tech Player
                          Suspended For Punching Opponent
body:
Utah Tech Player
                          Suspended For Punching Opponent
                          After Getting Posterized
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 9:31 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Utah Tech guard Chance Trujillo's retaliatory punch after getting dunked on in a game last week earned him a one-game suspension, the school told TMZ Sports.
      
    
          The altercation happened on December 3 ... when the UT Trailblazers played against the Santa Clara Broncos at the Leavey Center. SC's Allen Graves went up for a slam late in the game ... and Trujillo tried to block it, but failed.
      
    
      
      Chance Trujillo of Utah Tech punches Allen Graves of Santa Clara after getting dunked on by himğŸ«¨Graves need better teammates because how did not 1 of them even get in Trujillo's faceâ‰ï¸Team Chemistry -100 pic.twitter.com/Yh0Pk9mcg9â€” BetUS College Basketball ğŸ€ (@BetUS_NCAAHoops) December 4, 2025
              @BetUS_NCAAHoops
          
  
    
          Graves posterized Trujillo and bumped into him while he celebrated ... which led to the violent scene on the court.
      
    
          That outburst has now cost him some playing time.
      

          "Per NCAA rules, any player who throws a punch or is involved in a fight receives an automatic ejection and a one-game suspension, so he will be out on Saturday night against Justice University," a member of the Utah Tech athletics department says.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          "He will return on Saturday, Dec. 20, at Weber State."
      
    
          Trujillo, in his sophomore year, is averaging 11.7 points and 2.4 assists per game for the Trailblazers this season.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                TMZ Sports
              
                          
                Basketball
              
                          
                Fights & Feuds

schema.headline: Utah Tech Player Suspended For Punching Opponent After Getting Dunked On

title: Leonardo DiCaprio Announced as TIME's 2025 Entertainer of the Year
description:
Leonardo DiCaprio
                          It's About TIME ...
                          Named M
body:
Leonardo DiCaprio
                          It's About TIME ...
                          Named Magazine's Entertainer of the Year
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 8:18 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Leonardo DiCaprio is top dog this year ... 'cause TIME just crowned him the 2025 Entertainer of the Year.
      
    
          Of course, itâ€™s a major flex -- but totally tracks, since Leoâ€™s one of the most recognizable names in Hollywood, and his film "One Battle After Another" is already gearing up to bulldoze its way through award season.
      
    
          No flashy photoshoot here -- just a tight, brooding B&W headshot of Leo ... making its own statement, and very on-brand for a classic TIME cover.
      
    
          Leo told the mag he jumped on "One Battle After Another" because itâ€™s actually an original idea -- the kind studios usually get nervous over.
      
    
          But câ€™mon ... Leoâ€™s had insane box office pull since he was a kid, so this cover and title? Well-earned and then some!

title: Tyra Banks Shares Wild Santa Claus Conspiracy Theory at Australian Pub Gig
description:
Tyra Banks
                          Santa Is Trying to Sabotage Me!!!
body:
Tyra Banks
                          Santa Is Trying to Sabotage Me!!!
                          Supermodel Loses It While Promoting 'Hot Ice Cream'
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 11:13 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Tyra Banks baffled fans and aroused some concerns during an on-stage appearance Sunday in Sydney, Australia ... ranting about Santa Claus trying to sabotage her brand.
      
    
          The supermodel, TV host, and businesswoman reportedly DJ'd a set at a local pub when she launched into a tirade accusing Kris Kringle of counterfeiting her SMiZE & DREAM ice cream.
      
    
      
      Tyra Banks was spotted in Sydney, Australia ranting about Santa Claus on stage with drag queens while promoting her SMiZE & Dream ice cream brand. pic.twitter.com/1ZJAHlZcNEâ€” The Art Of Dialogue (@ArtOfDialogue_) December 8, 2025
              @ArtOfDialogue_
          
  
    
          Donning a knee-length yellow Santa hat, long canary-yellow wig, and skintight black dress, Tyra went off ... claiming Santa is lying about his intentions with the snacks we traditionally leave out for him.
      

          In a video shared on socials, she insisted, "Child, he ain't biting that cookie. He ain't sipping that cream. He taking a bowl from your cabinet ... and he putting a little bit of cookie, and he putting a little bit of that milk, and he mixing it up. And then he put it in your freezer. And he trying to make it taste like Santa SMiZE, and it tastes like Santa sh*t!"
      
    
          The video features several more inexplicable moments spliced together.
      
    
          "I think I'm going crazy!" she says in one isolated clip ... the context of which is not clear.
      
    
          Back in October, she admitted to Australia's News.com.au that people thought she was "crazy" for her SMiZE & DREAM store in Sydney selling "hot ice cream."
      
    
          She told the outlet ... "They drop in the DMs and ask if I need help. I know my desserts. It's a drinkable ice cream, but it's not a shake. We didn't just take it and melt it."
      
    
          While the hot ice cream may not be taking off, her single "Santa SMiZE, Santa SMiZE" is a holiday bop.

schema.headline: Tyra Banks Shares Wild Santa Claus Conspiracy Theory at Australian Pub Gig

title: 'Vampire Diaries' Candice King Turns Baby News Into Ad for Pregnancy Tests
description:
Candice King
                          I'm Having a Baby!!!
                          But First .
body:
Candice King
                          I'm Having a Baby!!!
                          But First ... Shout Out to My Sponsors!!!
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 10:22 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Literally everything is content nowadays ... "The Originals" star Candice King turned her pregnancy announcement into an ad for Clearblue pregnancy tests in a post shared Monday.
      
    
          The 38-year-old actress announced she's expecting a baby with her former costar Steven Kreuger, writing, "#ClearbluePartner Weâ€™re having a baby! Baby Krueger coming May 2026!"
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Seeing as how the post leads with a sponsored hashtag, you might wonder which thing she's happier about -- the new addition, or that sweet, sweet pregnancy test money. But then she added ...
      

                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          "Thereâ€™s nothing more magical than seeing the word pregnant ğŸ©µThank you @clearblue for providing us with a clear result in words, during a moment that left us speechless and overjoyed! The best gift we could hope for this holiday season. #ClearblueConfirmed" ... and now we're pretty sure it's the cash.
      
    
          The paid partnership -- err... baby -- marks Candice's first with Steven. The child will join big sisters Florence, 9, and Josephine, 5, whom Candice shares with her ex-husband Joe King.
